law.catch_line: A commissioner may be removed before the completion of the commissioner's term:...

text.section:
A commissioner may be removed before the completion of the commissioner's term:
in Montgomery County:
by the County Executive with the approval of a majority of the members of the County Council; or
unless the County Executive disapproves the resolution in writing within 30 days after its adoption, by resolution of a majority of the members of the County Council; and
in Prince George's County, by the County Executive with the approval of a majority of the members of the County Council.

section.section:
Unless a hearing is waived in writing by the commissioner designated for removal, before any removal under this section, a public hearing shall be held:
in Montgomery County, by the body initiating the removal proceeding; or
in Prince George's County, by the County Council.
The commissioner shall be given an opportunity at the hearing to present a defense.
